news.title: The U.S. Is Wrong to Ban Pay for Bone-Marrow Donors: Sally Satel
news.summary: Two years ago, Doreen Flynn of Lewiston, Maine, won her case against the U.S. government, successfully arguing that bone-marrow donors should be able to receive compensation.

news.title: Gift Cards Could Boost Blood Donation Amounts Without Safety Risks
news.summary: redOrbit Staff & Wire Reports - Your Universe Online Offering gift cards or other rewards to potential donors can increase the amount of blood provided for transfusions and other medical purposes without adverse safety effects, according to a new report pu

news.title: Free T-shirts, other non-cash incentives can up blood donations, study finds
news.summary: TORONTO - Maybe offering straight cash for a blood donation is a no-no, but research suggests that other incentives like free T-shirts and gift cards can boost donor rates without compromising the safety of the blood supply.

news.title: Should monetary incentives be offered for blood donation? Study says yes

news.title: Free T-shirts, other non-cash incentives can up blood donations: study
news.summary: TORONTO – Maybe offering straight cash for a blood donation is a no-no, but research suggests that other incentives like free T-shirts and gift cards can boost donor rates without compromising the safety of the blood supply. Writing Thursday in the journal

news.title: Economic Incentives Increase Blood Donations Without Negative Consequences
news.summary: Canada and other countries should reassess guidelines that prohibit offering economic incentives such as gift cards to potential blood donors, says a study from the University of Toronto Mississauga (UTM). "Blood donation guidelines recommended by the Worl

news.title: Economic incentives increase blood donation without negative consequences
Giving blood donors a good reason to give
news.summary: ( University of Toronto ) Canada and other countries should reassess guidelines that prohibit offering economic incentives such as gift cards to potential blood donors, says a study from the University of Toronto Mississauga.

news.title: Three ethical ways to increase organ donation in Australia
news.summary: It's time to go beyond improving the mechanisms for implementing existing laws. KieferPix/Shutterstock/Shutterstock Australia’s organ donation levels are low by international standards. At least twenty countries achieve better donation rates than Australia

news.title: Blood donation is valuable, so why not pay donors?
news.summary: Need more blood donors? Economists have a suggestion: Pay them.

news.summary: Australia's organ donation levels are low by international standards. At least twenty countries achieve better donation rates than Australia's 16.1 donors per million population (DPMP), including Belgium (29.9 DPMP), the United States (25.9), France (25.5)

news.title: Three ethical ways to increase organ donation in Australia
news.summary: by William Isdale and Julian Savulescu - Australia’s organ donation levels are low by international standards. At least twenty countries achieve better donation rates than Australia’s 16.1 donors per million population (DPMP), including Belgium (29.9 DPMP)

news.title: Why you get paid to donate plasma but not blood - STAT
news.summary: Donating plasma and donating blood are essentially the same process: the entry questionnaire, getting hooked up to a machine, the cookie afterward.

The IDB strives to find innovative and effective approaches to address Latin America and the Caribbean’s economic, social, institutional, and environmental development challenges.
